value.title: How Face Recognition Can Destroy Anonymity
value.excerpt: For most of human history, private citizens could reasonably assume they were more or less anonymous when venturing into public. Given the unchecked rise of face recognition, that's not a safe assumption anymore.

value.title: Virginia lawmakers ban police use of facial recognition technology

value.title: Chinese government-run facial recognition system hacked by tax fraudsters: report
value.excerpt: Concerns mount for data privacy in China, as a group duped a government-run facial recognition system to issue fake tax invoices valued at US$76.2 million.

value.title: Face Recognition with smiles, winks could increase phone security: Here's how
value.excerpt: The new system is called Concurrent Two-Factor Identity Verification (C2FIV) and it requires both one's facial identity and a specific facial motion to gain access.

value.title: Mojo Vision Will Power Its Smart Contact Lens With An External Compute Pack
value.excerpt: The Mojo smart contact lens, due to ship within the next few years, boasts 14,000 pixels per inch packed into a sand-grain-sized display that beams directly into your eyes’ fovea, the tiny part in the center of your eye with the greatest concentration of retinal cones: your natural photoreceptors.

value.title: Key task in computer vision and graphics gets a boost
value.excerpt: A researcher has devised a way to speed up a fundamental task in computer vision and graphics known as non-rigid point set registration. Unlike previous registration techniques, the proposed method is computationally efficient even for large data sets.
